name.description: "Allen ""Al"" Danos was born in Cut Off, La., around 1947 and attended Holy Cross High School in New Orleans. In his early twenties he joined his father, Allen Danos, Sr., in the family business, Danos and Curole Marine Contractors; he and his brother Hank took over the company in the early 1970s. Since his retirement in the early 2000s Danos has become a board member of Nicholls State University Foundation, a board member of the Houma-Thibodaux Diocese, and worked to develop tourism in Port Fourchon. He is a practicing Catholic, and lives in Cut Off with his wife. They have four children and five grandchildren."

subject.topic: Oil field equipment and supplies industry--Louisiana.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)

mods.abstract: "Danos focuses largely on his professional career with Danos and Curole, discussing domestic and international expansion efforts in the 1970s-1990s, with a particular focus on his work in oil production in Nigeria. He discusses his interest in the ""boat"" side of the business, and his activities since retirement in 2006. Danos discusses the Catholic community, his home life, Cajun heritage and current culture, and his regular gatherings with friends."
